thread.title: ESPN puts spotlight on JMU, but Richmond steals the show
thread.title_full: ESPN puts spotlight on JMU, but Richmond steals the show | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: The Virginian-Pilot
title: ESPN puts spotlight on JMU, but Richmond steals the show
text:
HARRISONBURG The atmosphere was festive. ESPN's GameDay crew was on hand. Lee Corso even dressed as founding father James Madison to predict a Dukes win.
But James Madison's football team was unable capitalize with a victory.
Jacobi Green ran for 236 yards on 27 carries and scored five touchdowns to help lead Richmond to a 59-49 win Saturday, snapping the Dukes' school-record 14 game regular-season winning streak.
Kyle Lauletta threw for 415 yards and two touchdowns and Brian Brown added 204 yards receiving for Richmond (6-1, 4-0 Colonial Athletic Association).
Bryan Schor's 7-yard TD pass to Rashard Davis cut the Dukes' (7-1, 4-1) deficit to 52-49 with 4:02 left. But Richmond responded on the ensuing possession, driving 69 yards on four plays capped by Green's 1-yard scoring run, pushing the lead back to 10.
A James Madison fumble by Cardon Johnson on the ensuing kickoff sealed the game for Richmond.
Vad Lee threw for 294 yards, ran for 124, and had five touchdowns for James Madison.
The teams combined for 1,305 yards of offense.
ESPN's Rece Davis was impressed with the pregame scene in Harrisonburg.
He tweeted: "Awesome @CollegeGameDay scene JMU. Salute"
Unfortunately for Dukes fans, the outcome of the game wasn't too awesome.
